author: timbeiko
content:
Small project proposal ‚≠ê 

This just came up on the AllCoreDevs call today: this PR needs testing before being merged: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/pull/398

It's on the critical path for the next fork! If someone wants to jump into something quick that has high immeditate value, it should be straightforward and likely isn't going to get done by the core teams for the next few weeks otherwise.

author: mohasdev
content: I'm reading this but i'm not very familiar with this repo so i have a few questions . So what you need is add test to the speccheck tool for the two new optional fields right ? But what are you waiting from the test cause they are optional ? You want to test the format of the fields or something like that ?

author: mohasdev
content: When i say optional i'm talking for the fields not the tests

author: lightclient
content: yeah at this point we're really only merging changes to the eth rpc if it has tests with it, this way we can see on the hive suite if clients implemented it correctly

author: lightclient
content: so we need tests written in rpctestgen and filled for the PR so speccheck can verify the spec against them

author: mohasdev
content: I have an idea on how to do this tests but i have a quick question to see if i'm doing wrong or not . rpctestgen is using go-ethereum for the tests and the [receipt struct of geth](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blob/master/core/types/receipt.go#L52)  don't have the two fields so i need to add them before writing the test right ?

author: mohasdev
content: oh sry i just saw that they have it on github üòÑ but on my vscode when i'm pointing to the geth pkg that rpctestgen is using this is not updated üòÆ

author: mohasdev
content: Ok i fixed this by updating the packages and adding new missing packages + added new required parameter : Blocktime to the tests that are using the function MakeSigner .

author: mohasdev
content: I'm sending a pr for this <@543900561460822016>

author: lightclient
content: thanks! we'll also need to update the generated chain to have some blobs so that we can verify the methods which return tx json return the correct values
